intro: Dissotis gilgiana var. petiolata, commonly known as the broad-leaved dissotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in humid and moist environments. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
